title: Why New Zealand will win the World Cup: Six reasons the All Blacks can make it a historic hat-trick... and one thing that might stop them
text:
You have to go back to the quarter-final defeat by France in the 2007 World Cup to find a time that the All Blacks were defeated in the World Cup.

After winning the first edition in 1987 they went through five World Cups - and 24 years - before they won another, on home soil in 2011.

Now they are strong favourites to make history and add a third consecutive title on top of their 2011 and 2015 cups. To do that, though, they first have to beat England in the semi-final on Saturday. And then face one of Wales or South Africa in the final.

Can they do it? In part two of a four-part series, Mick Cleary gives us six reasons...
description: You have to go back to the quarter-final defeat by France in the 2007 World Cup to find a time that the All Blacks were defeated in the World Cup.
